lexUnit.name: sneer.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a contemptuous or mocking smile, remark, or tone (in this frame, only the facial expression.)

sentence.text: His stumpy , yellowed silver moustache rides proudly over his camel-like sneer as he strides to the back of the bar , probably to renegotiate his olive and yoghurt contracts with the owner .
A faint sneer of satisfaction touched the corners of his mouth .
Dexter saw that Blanche could not hide a faint sneer of distaste at how the TV reporter had behaved .
John asked , lips drawn back in a sarcastic sneer .
His tone was cutting and his lips twisted in a cynical sneer .
His lip curled in a sneer , and a cold hand settled over her heart .
Her mouth contorted in a sneer .
" And your name ? " he demanded , his lip curling into a sneer .
Although I could n't actually see Maté 's sneer , I felt it in the darkness .
Ho was looking at him now with a sneer on his face .
Steven , Katz 's head waiter and full-time ` character " , serves up three mammoth egg mayonnaise sandwiches with a comic sneer on his face .
` Of course , " said Snyde with a slight sneer , smiling again this time coldly .
The sergeant flicked up the plastic film and scrutinised the tweed jacket and brown trousers with a faint sneer : he would n't be seen dead wearing such clothes .
Also now and then someone at one of the two tables might look at the other table with a sneer or an ugly remark .
Only then did she look carefully at the egg and with a slight sneer on her face turned and deposited it with a gesture of disgust in a nearby aspidistra pot .
The Prince smirked and Gaveston turned , for the first time acknowledging their presence with a condescending sneer .
Otherwise she felt certain he 'd dismiss the whole embarrassing situation with a careless sneer .
